page.title: 11MORE LOCAL HISTORY-BLEWBURY
page.content: CONTINUING DETAILS OF OPEN HOUSES. ORCHARD DENE HOUSE,SOUTH STREET:PART OF LAND CALLED JOYS IN THE PREBENDAL MANOR. WAYSIDE COTTAGE,WESTBROOK STREET:WAS THE PROPERTY OF THE SHOEMAKERS OF BLEWBURY AND WAS ACQUIRED BEFORE 1805. TREBLE HOUSE COTTAGE,LONDON ROAD:WAS INITIALLY THREE HOUSES AND BECAME A GROCER'S SHOP AROUND 1840.THE POST- OFFICE WAS HERE FROM 1914 TO I925. GREAT TREE,CHAPEL LANE: THE HOME FARM AND FAMILY HOME OF ONE OF THE OLDEST FAMILIES IN BLEWBURY AND CAN BE TRACED BACK AS FAR AS 1548. BLEWBURY ANTIQUES,LONDON ROAD:BUILT ABOUT 1940 WAS ORIGINALLY OWNED BY A FAMOUS JOCKEY.THE PRESENT OWNERS SELL TO A WORLDWIDE CLIENTELE.THE SHOP IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC DURING THE FESTIVAL. METHODIST CHAPEL,BY THE CLEVE:BUILT IN 1826 AS A WESLEYAN METHODIST CHAPEL.
